author: NBCNews.com
title: In Too Deep: The Trial
description: Dexter Filkins, a staff writer at The New Yorker, joins MSNBC's Ali Velshi to discuss his new piece that explores the story of a former F.B.I. Special Agent named Ali Soufan, a critic of Saudi Arabia, who fears that he may be MBS's new target.
source.name: MSNBC

author: NBCNews.com
title: Portland unrest grows as protesters clash with federal agents, police union headquarters is set on fire
description: Tensions in Portland continued to rise overnight as protesters clashed with federal agents and set the police union headquarters ablaze, but who is to blame for the city's increase in violence?
source.name: MSNBC

title: Pettus descendant: Renaming Selma’s bridge after John Lewis ‘gives a more complete picture of history’
description: Caroline Randall Williams, Vanderbilt University writer-in-residence and great-great granddaughter of Confederate general Edmund Pettus, says the current name erases the contributions of Lewis and other Black Americans.
source.name: MSNBC

author: NBCNews.com
title: Velshi: Trump has never been able to keep his promises
description: MSNBC’s Ali Velshi argues that Trump squandered the strength of the economy in his first three years and now has no chance of achieving the national prosperity he campaigned on.
source.name: MSNBC

title: Tom Perez: Calling Trump’s racist comments ‘dog whistles’ is insulting to dogs
description: Democratic National Committee chair Tom Perez says that in contrast to the late Rep. John Lewis, remembered for his capacity to forgive, Trump “constantly puts gasoline on fires.”
source.name: MSNBC

author: NBCNews.com
title: Sen. Doug Jones: The South can become ‘a place of healing’
description: Democratic Senator Doug Jones of Alabama pays tribute to civil rights leader John Lewis and says his Southern colleagues should be “a voice of unification” during the president’s culture wars.
source.name: MSNBC

author: NBCNews.com
title: Rev. Barber: If you care about police brutality, you can’t ignore ‘economic violence’
description: Rev. William Barber, co-chair of the Poor People’s Campaign and president of Repairers of the Breach, says the wave of evictions and loss of health insurance will harm millions of Americans during the pandemic.
source.name: MSNBC

author: NBCNews.com
title: Trump defends coronavirus criticisms on Fox News: 'It's going to disappear and I'll be right'
description: President Donald Trump appeared on Fox News with host Chris Wallace in a wide-ranging interview covering topics like the ongoing coronavirus pandemic where the president defended himself from criticisms while also commenting on masks and Dr. Anthony Fauci.
source.name: MSNBC

author: NBCNews.com
title: Barber: John Lewis talked about jobs and poverty in 1963
description: John Lewis also championed the poor as a civil rights leader Rev. Dr. William Barber reminds us as we mourn the passing of this great statesman and American patriot dedicated to equality.
source.name: MSNBC

author: NBCNews.com
title: In an age of disruption, pundits praise diverse media voices
description: Donald Trump scandals, policing protests over the shooting deaths of unarmed black people such as George Floyd and Breonna Taylor, and more critical issues are now covered in new ways Joy Reid’s panel says, as more diverse media voices bring nuance to press c…
source.name: MSNBC

author: NBCNews.com
title: MSNBC analyst Nance slams federal agents apprehending protesters
description: Donald Trump’s foreign and domestic policy controversies--from the Russian bounties scandal to federal agent apprehending protesters--are discussed by MSNBC analyst Malcolm Nance on this final edition of AM JOY hosted by Joy Reid.
source.name: MSNBC

author: NBCNews.com
title: Dozens of college basketball coaches team up to create more opportunities for minorities
description: Dozens of collegiate coaches are teaming up to boost representation in their field through the McLendon Foundation Minority Leadership Initiative. It’s co-chaired by Harvard coach Tommy Amaker and University of Kentucky coach John Calipari who joined Alex Wit…
source.name: MSNBC

author: NBCNews.com
title: Oregon Attorney General: 'Oregonians are not going to be scared or silenced by this administration'
description: Oregon Attorney General Ellen Rosenblum tells MSNBC’s Joshua Johnson that federal forces “have done no good at all” arresting Portland protesters. “They do not know what they are doing, and they’re making things a whole lot worse,” she said. “They need to lea…
source.name: MSNBC

author: NBCNews.com
title: Rob Reiner: My father hoped to live to vote Trump out
description: The late Carl Reiner’s wish to see Donald Trump voted out is revealed by his son, director and activist Rob Reiner, in conversation with Joy Reid.
source.name: MSNBC

author: NBCNews.com
title: Lawrence O’Donnell joins Joy Reid to discuss her new show
description: Donald Trump’s pandemic response is criticized by Lawrence O’Donnell, who also joins Joy Reid to discuss her new prime time show, The REIDOut, airing at 7 pm ET weeknights on MSNBC.
source.name: MSNBC

author: NBCNews.com
title: Joy Reid and panel discuss 2020 election, her new primetime show
description: Republican party are analyzed by experts as Joy Reid and her panel celebrate four years of AM JOY success and her new prime time show, The REIDOut, airing at 7 pm ET weeknights on MSNBC.
source.name: MSNBC

author: NBCNews.com
title: Rep. Johnson: ‘There's nobody in Congress who has not been positively impacted by being associated with John Lewis’
description: Rep. Hank Johnson (D-GA) talks to Kasie Hunt about what the loss of Rep. John Lewis means to the House as a whole.
source.name: MSNBC
